title: The Tragic Leash Cliffhanger
description: The doors start to close as a kid rushes in. His tiny dog, Sir Wigglebottom, is still outside. The leash is caught between the doors, pulled taut like a cartoon physics experiment.

options.text: Hit the door open button and gently pull the leash to bring Sir Wigglebottom in.
options.consequence_text: You save the pup, the kid beams, and everyone silently agrees you are now elevator captain.

options.text: Shout 'Abort mission!' and grab the leash, but accidentally pull yourself halfway out.
options.consequence_text: The dog is fine, you're slightly bruised, and the elevator now respects your chaotic energy.

options.text: Do nothing. This is a physics problem for future adults.
options.consequence_text: The doors reopen automatically, the dog trots in unharmed, and the guilt hovers like elevator music.

title: Just Ben (Totally Original)
description: The doors open and a man who looks suspiciously like a certain movie star steps in, humming 'I am just Ben, anywhere else I'd be a ten.'

options.text: Casually nod and say, 'Big fan of your… legally distinct work.'
options.consequence_text: He winks and says, 'Thanks, I’m just Ben.' The entire elevator levels up in coolness.

options.text: Start humming along, perfectly in sync, full eye contact.
options.consequence_text: Everyone else stares at the floor. Ben looks impressed and slightly afraid.

options.text: Press 'Door Open' and loudly announce, 'This elevator is for mortals only.'
options.consequence_text: He laughs, steps out dramatically, and the doors close on your power trip.

title: The Great Coffee Quake
description: A person walks in balancing a tray with four coffees. The elevator lurches slightly. Time slows. Destiny smells like espresso.

options.text: Grab the tray like an action hero and stabilize it.
options.consequence_text: Not a single drop is spilled. You are briefly worshipped as a caffeine deity.

options.text: Offer your empty tote bag as an emergency spill zone.
options.consequence_text: Your bag is now a mocha swamp, but the floor survives. Karma +10, bag -100.

options.text: Press a random floor and step out before the physics happens.
options.consequence_text: You escape the coffee tsunami, but you will always know what you did not do.

title: The Elevator Theremin
description: As the doors open, the muzak morphs into eerie sci‑fi sounds. A stranger waves their hands, insisting the elevator is actually a giant theremin.

options.text: Join in and 'play' a duet, matching their movements.
options.consequence_text: You both create haunting elevator music. Everyone else rethinks their life choices.

options.text: Politely ask them to stop and suggest headphones.
options.consequence_text: They apologize and switch to humming softly. The tension resolves like a jazz chord.

options.text: Pretend to be an elevator inspector and take notes on their 'performance'.
options.consequence_text: They play even harder, convinced this is an audition. You’ve made a monster.

title: Accidental Group Therapy
description: A coworker enters, sighs deeply, and says, 'Since we’re all here, I need to vent about the meeting.' Doors close. No escape.

options.text: Act as therapist, nodding and asking gentle follow‑up questions.
options.consequence_text: They feel better. You acquire unofficial emotional support responsibilities.

options.text: Start a 'talking stick' with the 'door open' button.
options.consequence_text: Everyone shares. The elevator becomes a tiny, mildly effective support group.

options.text: Pretend you just remembered another floor and bail.
options.consequence_text: You avoid drama, but the coworker’s sigh echoes in your soul.

title: Schröding‑ish Cat
description: A traveler rushes in with a suitcase. A faint 'mrrp' sound comes from inside. They freeze. Everyone heard it.

options.text: Gently ask if they also heard the 'mrrp' and offer help.
options.consequence_text: It’s their cat, accidentally zipped in. You help rescue it. The cat immediately ignores you.

options.text: Start meowing back in different tones to triangulate the cat.
options.consequence_text: The cat meows, you meow, everyone accepts this now.

options.text: Stare straight ahead, pretending nothing is wrong with reality.
options.consequence_text: The doors open; they rush off. The mystery cat lives only in your memory.

title: Ghost of Fire Drills Past
description: The elevator stops at an empty floor. A faint alarm plays the wrong tune, like a fire drill remixed by a DJ.

options.text: Suggest everyone exit and take the stairs, just in case.
options.consequence_text: You all take the stairs. It was a false alarm, but your calves level up.

options.text: Joke that the building is just testing your cardio anxiety.
options.consequence_text: Tension breaks, people laugh, the elevator seems to approve.

options.text: Declare this floor cursed and mash the 'close doors' button.
options.consequence_text: The doors close. If there were ghosts, they are now mildly offended.

title: Pop‑Up Book Club
description: Someone steps in holding a book you love and sighs, 'No one I know has read this.'

options.text: Excitedly say, 'I have!' and start a 30‑second speed review.
options.consequence_text: You bond instantly. The elevator becomes a tiny book club.

options.text: Ask them what they like about it and just listen.
options.consequence_text: They light up. You earn social XP without spoilers.

options.text: Lean over to read the blurb silently like a book ninja.
options.consequence_text: You get the gist. They definitely notice. You pretend they don’t.

title: The Extra Button
description: You notice a button that shouldn’t exist: Floor ∞. It glows softly. No one else seems to react.

options.text: Press it without hesitation. Chaos speedrun.
options.consequence_text: The panel flickers, then everything returns to normal. Or did it?

options.text: Ask if anyone else sees the extra button.
options.consequence_text: Half say no, half say yes. You have accidentally formed a cult or a group chat.

options.text: Pretend you did not see it. That feels safer.
options.consequence_text: You remain in the normal elevator narrative. Probably.

title: Elevator Dance Break
description: The music suddenly switches to an upbeat track. A stranger starts doing tiny, contained dance moves.

options.text: Join with subtle shoulder shimmies.
options.consequence_text: Soon half the elevator is doing micro‑dances. Morale increases by 10%.

options.text: Go full dance battle. No half‑measures.
options.consequence_text: You win the invisible trophy. The doors open to a stunned audience outside.

options.text: Stare at your phone like nothing is happening.
options.consequence_text: You remain unbothered, unmoved, and slightly less interesting.

title: Fog of Fragrance
description: Someone enters trailing a cloud of perfume so dense it could be classified as weather.

options.text: Crack a window that does not exist by pantomiming dramatically.
options.consequence_text: People giggle, and somehow it does feel easier to breathe.

options.text: Offer them a compliment on the scent, then discreetly face the corner.
options.consequence_text: They smile. Your lungs file a complaint, but your manners win.

options.text: Loudly ask if anyone else is tasting flowers.
options.consequence_text: The air gets awkward, if not fresher.

title: Mystery Crunch
description: At midnight, someone boards with a loud crunchy snack. Every bite echoes like a boss battle sound effect.

options.text: Ask what they’re eating and trade snack recommendations.
options.consequence_text: You form a temporary snack alliance. Peace through chips.

options.text: Chew imaginary food in sync to create a weird rhythm.
options.consequence_text: You two accidentally invent elevator ASMR. Opinions are mixed.

options.text: Passive‑aggressively put on noise‑cancelling headphones with exaggerated motions.
options.consequence_text: They get the hint. The crunching gets quieter, the tension louder.

title: Clone Outfit Moment
description: You and a stranger are wearing almost the exact same outfit. Everyone notices at the same time.

options.text: Say, 'One of us has to change floors.'
options.consequence_text: They laugh. The elevator becomes your shared runway.

options.text: High‑five them and declare it a team uniform.
options.consequence_text: Others assume you work together at a very fun company.

options.text: Slowly turn so your outfits are never fully in the same frame.
options.consequence_text: You successfully avoid acknowledgment. At what cost?

title: Live, Laugh, Lift
description: The elevator doors open onto a floor that seems to be only motivational posters and plants. No people. Just vibes.

options.text: Step out, take a deep breath, and read one poster dramatically.
options.consequence_text: You gain +1 temporary optimism. The doors wait patiently.

options.text: Convince everyone to do a 10‑second group power pose.
options.consequence_text: Confidence rises. Someone actually thanks you for the mini‑ritual.

options.text: Press 'close' repeatedly, whispering 'not today, fonts.'
options.consequence_text: You return to your regularly scheduled chaos.

title: The Confused Delivery Bot
description: A tiny delivery robot rolls into the elevator, chirps 'RECALCULATING,' and spins in place.

options.text: Read its label and help it get to the right floor.
options.consequence_text: The bot beeps 'THANK YOU ORGANIC' and rolls out heroically.

options.text: Teach it to say 'elevator acquired' before leaving.
options.consequence_text: You upgrade its catchphrase. Future riders will know you were here.

options.text: Gently spin it and let destiny decide its floor.
options.consequence_text: It seems delighted. Logistics, less so.

title: Speakerphone Saga
description: Someone is on a loud speakerphone call, sharing every detail of their day with the elevator.

options.text: Politely ask if they can switch off speaker 'for the elevator’s mental health.'
options.consequence_text: They apologize and comply. The elevator’s sanity bar refills.

options.text: Start reacting to their story like a live studio audience.
options.consequence_text: The caller gets confused; the rider considers changing their life.

options.text: Put your own phone on speaker and play calming ocean sounds.
options.consequence_text: No one wins. Except maybe the ocean.

title: Unexpected Furniture
description: There is a single office chair in the middle of the elevator. No explanation. No owner in sight.

options.text: Sit in it like you absolutely belong there.
options.consequence_text: Everyone assumes you are in charge of the elevator now.

options.text: Ask the next person who enters, 'Appointment for Chair?'
options.consequence_text: Confusion turns into shared laughter. The chair remains neutral.

options.text: Carefully push it to the corner and stand like nothing happened.
options.consequence_text: The universe is slightly less weird. Some would call that a loss.

title: Mirror Pep‑Talk
description: You catch your reflection in the elevator mirror giving you a look that says, 'Say something inspiring.'

options.text: Deliver a short, dramatic pep‑talk to your reflection out loud.
options.consequence_text: Awkward? Yes. Inspiring? Also yes.

options.text: Quietly mouth 'you’ve got this' and smile.
options.consequence_text: Your reflection approves. A nearby stranger smiles too.

options.text: Avoid eye contact and check imaginary emails.
options.consequence_text: You remain neutral‑powered. The elevator shrugs.

title: Briefly Trapped Together
description: The elevator shudders and stops for a few seconds between floors. The silence becomes very loud.

options.text: Crack a gentle joke about 'bonding trauma.'
options.consequence_text: People laugh nervously, but the fear bar goes down.

options.text: Calmly reassure everyone that this happens all the time.
options.consequence_text: Whether it’s true or not, everyone relaxes a bit.

options.text: Announce, 'We live here now,' and start assigning chores.
options.consequence_text: The elevator moves again before anyone can object.
